ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to perform osteological work and procedures
How to design and complete an independent research project; how to manage long-term deadlines; how to dig into an area of interest and reach anthropological conclusions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: While I appreciated the flexibility of the senior essay, I think definitely would have benefited from a more structured approach to it, especially for doing a year-long project. If there was a scheduled time every week for seniors to meet and work together/share updates (doesn't even have to be mandatory!!), I think I would have been so much better at time management and it would have saved me some pain the week leading up to the thesis deadline
I would appreciate a sense of the larger thesis-writing cohort throughout the semester, but I otherwise had a great time digging into this project.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would encourage students to take up independent research while you can on Yale's dime. There are so many funding opportunities available for you to pursue research on any topic of your interest. It's a great way to develop interest and expertise on something. Anthropological research in particular is so enriching because so much of it is self-directed and you really get to challenge your own positionality
Yes, if you want to take on real ownership of a project and challenge yourself with deadlines, time management, and a project of a scope well beyond anything that I'd done at Yale to date.
